intro: Phyteuma americanum, commonly known as American phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and produces showy, violet-blue flowers in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly rough texture. It is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
